title: Quadrant pounces on QMS Media for $420m
text:
Quadrant Private Equity has made its move for out-of-home advertising business QMS Media with a deal to take the business off the Australian sharemarket after four years as a public company.

The deal, first revealed by The Australian Financial Review's Street Talk column on Friday afternoon, will see Quadrant pay $1.22 per share for QMS Media, valuing the company's equity at $420.6 million and giving it a total enterprise value of $571.6 million.

Quadrant's offer is all cash and QMS shareholders will also be entitled to a final dividend of up to 1.3¢ for the 2019 calendar year.

"The recommended acquisition of QMS by Quadrant represents an excellent outcome for our shareholders, partners and employees," QMS chief executive Barclay Nettlefold said in a statement.

"It is a testament to our sustained growth in a challenging market, and our continued market leading digital revenue contribution, led by our strong and experienced executive management team.”

The scheme between QMS and Quadrant sees equity held by Mr Barclay and QMS Media Australia chief executive John O'Neil being rolled over into scrip in a holding company rather than the cash offer for other shareholders.
